verses.verse: Therefore <WG1352> leaving <WG863> the teaching <WG3056> of <WG746> the first principles <WG746> of Christ, <WG5547> let us press on <WG5342> to <WG1909> perfection <WG5047> â€” not <WG3361> laying <WG2598> again <WG3825> a foundation <WG2310> of repentance <WG3341> from <WG575> dead <WG3498> works, <WG2041> of faith <WG4102> toward <WG1909> God, <WG2316>

of the teaching <WG1322> of baptisms, <WG909> of <WG5037> laying on <WG1936> of hands, <WG5495> of resurrection <WG386> of <WG2917> the dead, <WG3498> and <WG5037> of <WG2917> eternal <WG166> judgment. <WG2917>
<WG2532> This <WG5124> will we do, <WG4160> if <WG1437> God <WG2316> permits. <WG2010>

For <WG1063> concerning those who were <WG5461> once <WG530> enlightened <WG5461> and <WG5037> tasted <WG1089> of the <WG1431> heavenly <WG2032> gift, <WG1431> and <WG2532> were made <WG1096> partakers <WG3353> of the <WG4151> Holy <WG40> Spirit, <WG4151>
and <WG2532> tasted <WG1089> the <WG4487> good <WG2570> word <WG4487> of God, <WG2316> and <WG5037> the powers <WG1411> of the age <WG165> to come, <WG3195>

and <WG2532> then fell away, <WG3895> it is impossible <WG102> to <WG1519> renew them <WG340> again <WG3825> to <WG1519> repentance; <WG3341> seeing they crucify <WG388> the Son <WG5207> of God <WG2316> for themselves <WG1438> again, <WG2532> and put him to open shame. <WG3856>

For <WG1063> the land <WG1093> which <WG3588> has drunk <WG4095> the rain <WG5205> that comes <WG2064> often <WG4178> on <WG1909> it, <WG846> and <WG2532> brings forth <WG5088> a <WG2532> crop suitable <WG2111> for them <WG1565> <WG2532> for <WG1223> whose <WG3739> sake it is also tilled, <WG1090> receives <WG3335> blessing <WG2129> from <WG575> God; <WG2316>

but <WG1161> if it bears <WG1627> thorns <WG173> and <WG2532> thistles, <WG5146> it is rejected <WG96> and <WG2532> near <WG1451> being cursed, <WG2671> whose <WG3739> end <WG5056> is to <WG1519> be burned. <WG2740>

But, <WG1161> beloved, <WG27> we are persuaded <WG3982> of better things <WG2909> for <WG4012> you, <WG5216> and <WG2532> things that accompany <WG2192> salvation, <WG1487> even <WG2532> though we <WG2980> speak <WG2980> like this. <WG3779>

For <WG1063> God <WG2316> is not <WG3756> unrighteous, <WG94> so as to forget <WG1950> your <WG5216> work <WG2041> and <WG2532> the labor <WG2873> of love <WG26> which <WG3739> you showed <WG1731> toward <WG1519> his <WG846> name, <WG3686> in that you served <WG1247> the saints, <WG40> and <WG2532> still do serve them. <WG1247>

<WG1161> We desire that <WG1937> each one <WG1538> of you <WG5216> may show <WG1731> the <WG4710> same <WG846> diligence <WG4710> to <WG4314> the fullness <WG4136> of hope <WG1680> even to <WG891> the end, <WG5056>

that <WG2443> you won't <WG3361> be <WG1096> sluggish, <WG3576> but <WG1161> imitators <WG3402> of those who <WG2816> through <WG1223> faith <WG4102> and <WG2532> patience <WG3115> inherited <WG2816> the promises. <WG1860>

For <WG1063> when <WG1861> God <WG2316> made a promise <WG1861> to Abraham, <WG11> since <WG1893> he could <WG2192> swear <WG3660> by <WG2596> none <WG3762> greater, <WG3173> he swore <WG3660> by <WG2596> himself, <WG1438>
saying, <WG2229> "Surely <WG3375> blessing <WG2127> I will bless <WG2127> you, <WG4571> and <WG2532> multiplying <WG4129> I will multiply <WG4129> you. <WG4571>"
<WG2532> Thus, <WG3779> having patiently endured, <WG3114> he obtained <WG2013> the promise. <WG1860>

For <WG1063> men <WG444> indeed <WG3303> swear <WG3660> by <WG2596> a greater <WG3187> one, <WG2532> and in every <WG3956> dispute <WG485> of theirs <WG846> the oath <WG3727> is final <WG4009> for <WG1519> confirmation. <WG951>

<WG3739> In <WG1722> this way God, <WG2316> being determined <WG1014> to show <WG1925> more abundantly <WG4054> to the heirs <WG2818> of the promise <WG1860> the immutability <WG276> of <WG1012> his <WG846> counsel, <WG1012> interposed <WG3315> with an oath; <WG3727>

that <WG2443> by <WG1223> two <WG1417> immutable <WG276> things, <WG4229> in <WG1722> which <WG3739> it is impossible <WG102> for God <WG2316> to lie, <WG5574> we may have <WG2192> a <WG3874> strong <WG2478> encouragement, <WG3874> who have fled for refuge <WG2703> to take hold <WG2902> of the hope <WG1680> set before us. <WG4295>

This <WG3739> hope we have <WG2192> as <WG5613> an anchor <WG45> of the soul, <WG5590> a hope both <WG5037> sure <WG804> and <WG2532> steadfast <WG949> and <WG2532> entering <WG1525> into <WG1519> that which is within <WG2082> the veil; <WG2665>

where <WG3699> as <WG1525> a forerunner <WG4274> Jesus <WG2424> entered <WG1525> for <WG5228> us, <WG2257> having become <WG1096> a high priest <WG749> <WG1519> forever <WG165> after <WG2596> the order <WG5010> of Melchizedek. <WG3198>
